data.title: 2022 Annual Bibliography – International T. S. Eliot Society
data.text:
compiled by Ariadne Lewis, who is a Ph.D. student and research assistant at Baylor University. Her research interests center around narratology and the intersection of silence and religion in nineteenth-century British literature.

If you have any corrections or additions, please send them to tseliot.studies.annual@gmail.com.

Books

Budziak, Anna. T.S. Eliot’s Ariel Poems: Making Sense of the Times. New York: Routledge, 2022.

Crawford, Robert. Eliot After The Waste Land. New York: Farrar, Straus and Giroux, 2022.

Eiss, Harry Edwin. A Detailed Explication of T. S. Eliot’s The Love Song of J. Alfred Prufrock. Newcastle upon Tyne, UK: Cambridge Scholars Publishing, 2022.

Eliot, T. S., and Michael North. The Waste Land and Other Poems: Authoritative Texts, Contexts, Criticism. Second ed. New York: W. W. Norton & Company, 2022.

Eliot, T. S., and Valerie Eliot. The Waste Land: A Facsimile & Transcript of the Original Drafts Including the Annotations of Ezra Pound. Centenary edition. New York: Liveright, 2022.

Gordon, Lyndall. The Hyacinth Girl: T. S. Eliot’s Hidden Muse. New York: W. W. Norton & Company, 2022.

Hollis, Matthew. The Waste Land: A Biography of a Poem. London: W. W. Norton & Company, 2022.

Jagger, Jasmine. Rhythms of Feeling in Edward Lear, T. S. Eliot, and Stevie Smith. Oxford, UK: Oxford University Press, 2022.

Matthews, Steven. The Waste Land After One Hundred Years. Cambridge, UK: D. S. Brewer, 2022.

Rasula, Jed. What the Thunder Said: How The Waste Land Made Poetry Modern. Princeton: Princeton University Press, 2022.

Sicari, Stephen. Modernist Reformations: Poetry as Theology in Eliot, Stevens, and Joyce. Clemson, SC: Clemson University Press, 2022.

Book Chapters

Bedsole, Anna. “Uncertainty, Doubt, and Belief in the Poetic Landscapes of T. S. Eliot and Thomas Hardy.” Re-Reading the Age of Innovation: Victorians, Moderns, and Literary Newness, 1830-1950. Edited by Louise Kane. New York: Routledge, 2022.

Eagleton, Terry. “T. S. Eliot.” Critical Revolutionaries: Five Critics Who Changed the Way We Read. New Haven, CT: Yale University Press, 2022. 12-79.

Goldberg, Jonathan. “Impersonal Eliot.” Being of Two Minds: Modernist Literary Criticism and Early Modern Texts. New York: Fordham University Press, 2022. 25-66.

Hadjiyiannis, Christos. “Liberalism.” The Cambridge Companion to Twentieth-Century Literature and Politics. Edited by Christos Hadjiyiannis and Rachel Potter. Cambridge, UK: Cambridge University Press, 2022. 19–35. [considers TSE’s relationship to Edwardian liberalism]

Moran, James. “T. S. Eliot: Theatre and Popularity.” Modernists and the Theatre: The Drama of W. B. Yeats, Ezra Pound, D. H. Lawrence, James Joyce, T. S. Eliot and Virginia Woolf. London: Methuen Drama, 2022. 121–42.

Nickerson, A. J. “Visible Swans: Walter De La Mare and T. S. Eliot.” Walter de la Mare: Critical Appraisals. Edited by Yui Kajita, Angela Leighton, and A. J. Nickerson. Liverpool: Liverpool University Press, 2022. 109–126.

Prudente, Teresa. “The Secretest Chamber of the Heart: The Vita Nova in British and American Modernism.” The Afterlife of Dante’s Vita Nova in the Anglophone World: Interdisciplinary Perspectives on Translation and Reception History. Edited by Federica Coluzzi and Jacob Blakesley. New York: Routledge, 2022. 139–54.

Sherry, Vincent. “Transitions, Turns.” British Literature in Transition, 1900–1920: A New Age? Edited by James Purdon. Cambridge, UK: Cambridge University Press, 2022. 229–43.

Journal Publications

Ajtony, Zsuzsanna. “Translating Poetry – an Impossible Task?: T. S. Eliot’s Old Possum’s Book of Practical Cats in Hungarian.” Acta Universitatis Sapientiae Philologica 14, no. 3 (2022): 1–12.

Alexander, Michael. “The Waste Land and the Road to Emmaus.” Revista Canaria de Estudios Ingleses 85 (2022): 87–95.

Ali, Ayad Hammad. “Metaphoric Usage of Human Body Parts in T. S. Eliot’s Selected Poems.” Journal of Tikrit University for Humanities 29, no. 1 (2022): 35–56.

Altieri, Charles. “The Concept of Experience as Grounding for The Waste Land.” Revista Canaria de Estudios Ingleses 85 (2022): 35–50.

Arafat, Yasir, Muhammad Qasim, and Tahir Alam Awan. “The Land and the Waste: Meaninglessness and Absurdity in T. S. Eliot’s The Waste Land.” Sir Syed Journal of Education & Social Research 5, no. 4 (2022): 141-146.

Bacigalupo, Massimo. “The Waste Land at 100: Comedy in Hell.” Journal of Early Modern Studies 11 (2022): 253–57.

Brlek, Tomislav. “The Nietzschean Premise of Eliot’s Historical Sense.” Arcadia: Internationale Zeitschrift Für Literaturwissenschaft 57, no. 1 (2022): 112–20.

Brooker, Jewel Spears. “Eliot Reading Eliot: Pipit, the Hyacinth Girl, and the Silent Lady.” The T. S. Eliot Studies Annual 4 (2022) 25–41.

Brooker, Jewel Spears. “Inside/Outside: Eliot, Perspective, and the Modernist Moment.” Revista Canaria de Estudios Ingleses 85 (2022): 21–33.

Çakar, Emre. “Re-Visiting T. S. Eliot’s Poetry through Henri Lefebvre’s Rhythmanalysis.” Celal Bayar Üniversitesi Sosyal Bilimler Dergisi 20, no. 1 (2022): 298–309.

Chenal, Lise. “T. S. Eliot in Translations: Exploring T. S. Eliot’s Afterlives.” Transatlantica 2 (Dec. 2022).

Clemens, Ruth Alison. “Bombast and Sesquipedalian Words: Translation, Mistranslation, and the Epigraph to The Waste Land.” Modernist Cultures 17, no. 1 (Feb. 2022): 109–26.

Clemens, Ruth Alison. “Eliot and Europe [Special Section].” The T. S. Eliot Studies Annual 4, (2022): 253–308.

Derdeyn, Leeann. “Out of This Nettle: T. S. Eliot’s ‘Little Gidding III’ and the Environment of What Grows.” Modernism/Modernity 29, no. 3 (Sept. 2022): 495–518.
